title: J-Lo's New Perfume 'Promise' Was Basically Inspired By The Scent Of Money
text:
From ELLE

2019 is being re-named as the year of Jennifer Lopez. Not only is she sparking rumours of a possible Oscar nomination for her role in blockbuster hit Hustlers, she turned 50, been on her sellout ‘It’s My Party’ tour and got engaged to her boyfriend of two years, Alex Rodriguez. It’s been a big year for J-Lo and it’s just got even bigger because she’s launched her 25th scent in her fragrance empire.

The singer first launched her signature scent Glow in 2002 and it’s been a staple of ours ever since. In fact she’s earned a staggering £2 billion in revenue from her perfumes since they launched. It's fair to say Lopez has dominated the fragrance game.

We earn a commission for products purchased through some links in this article.

SHOP NOW

The actress' newest perfume 'Promise', is available online from today and in stores from the 9th October. A delicious mix of jasmine, honeysuckle and pink berry notes, 'Promise' is well within the sweeter scent palette we've come to know and love from J-Lo.



Photo credit: . More

When asked what inspired the music icon to create the scent, Lopez said:



‘I was having dinner with Warren Buffett and he told me something that really resonates with me: a brand is a promise. It’s a foundation that keeps us going. We all make promises to ourselves and one another, they are meant to be forever’.

Fragrances just got deep. And monied. Buffett has a casual net worth of $82billion so we're guessing J-Lo got some pretty good business advice...

The bottle will set you back £32 for 50ml or £42 for 100ml, which you can buy here.

The news comes as Lopez also announced on her Instagram yesterday that she will be joining Shakira to play the Pepsi Half Time show at the 54th Super Bowl, taking place on the 2nd February 2020. Is there anything J-Lo can’t do? We think not.
